result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrell A Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrell A Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Montrell A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion in Limine, filed by the State
Jury Instructions, filed by the State

Defendant Montrell A Johnson in court with attorney Maryan Corea for Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  No victim notification needed.  Attorney Corea requests adjournment as Attorney Obscherning is out due to family emergency.  Court grants request.  
  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montrell A Johnson in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Montrell A Johnson in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@2p
